items.title: McDonald’s reports largest U.S. same-store sales decline since 2020
items.content: McDonald's narrowly beat on earnings per share for the first quarter, but fell short on revenue.
items.contentSnippet: McDonald's narrowly beat on earnings per share for the first quarter, but fell short on revenue.

items.title: GM lowers 2025 guidance, citing up to $5 billion in tariff exposure
CVS tops estimates, hikes guidance as insurance business shows some improvement
items.content: The company now expects full-year adjusted earnings of $6 to $6.20 per share, up from a previous guidance of $5.75 to $6 per share.
items.contentSnippet: The company now expects full-year adjusted earnings of $6 to $6.20 per share, up from a previous guidance of $5.75 to $6 per share.

items.title: Eli Lilly sales soar 45% on weight loss drug demand, but drugmaker cuts profit outlook after cancer treatment deal
items.content: Eli Lilly said sales of weight loss drug Zepbound and diabetes treatment Mounjaro soared in the first quarter.
items.contentSnippet: Eli Lilly said sales of weight loss drug Zepbound and diabetes treatment Mounjaro soared in the first quarter.

items.title: How wealthy horse owners finance their passion and potentially earn millions
items.content: The Kentucky Derby's first place prize is $3.1 million, but track winnings aren't the most lucrative part of race horse ownership.
items.contentSnippet: The Kentucky Derby's first place prize is $3.1 million, but track winnings aren't the most lucrative part of race horse ownership.

items.title: Billionaire Lukas Walton names new CIO for his family office
items.content: Noelle Laing will take the reins after managing the firm's $1.7 billion endowment for philanthropy.
items.contentSnippet: Noelle Laing will take the reins after managing the firm's $1.7 billion endowment for philanthropy.

items.title: CVS to boost access to Novo Nordisk's weight loss treatment Wegovy for patients on its drug plans
items.content: Starting July 1, Caremark will prioritize Wegovy on its formulary, making the weekly injection more accessible to its members.
items.contentSnippet: Starting July 1, Caremark will prioritize Wegovy on its formulary, making the weekly injection more accessible to its members.

items.title: RFK Jr. is gutting minority health offices across HHS that are key to reducing health disparities
items.content: The cuts have hit most of the eight minority health offices across HHS, in many cases laying off the majority of workers, if not all of them, sources said.
items.contentSnippet: The cuts have hit most of the eight minority health offices across HHS, in many cases laying off the majority of workers, if not all of them, sources said.

items.title: Ford CEO says Trump's tariff reprieve is helpful, but more changes needed
items.content: Ford CEO Jim Farley said it's "essential" for U.S. policies to encourage exports as well as reward companies, such as Ford, for their American production
items.contentSnippet: Ford CEO Jim Farley said it's "essential" for U.S. policies to encourage exports as well as reward companies, such as Ford, for their American production

items.title: Dollar General is one of the best stock performers of Trump's first 100 days
items.content: Analysts say a market rotation to defensive stocks and Dollar General's lower exposure to China tariffs have boosted the stock.
items.contentSnippet: Analysts say a market rotation to defensive stocks and Dollar General's lower exposure to China tariffs have boosted the stock.

items.title: Yum Brands revenue misses as Pizza Hut's same-store sales fall 2%
items.content: Yum Brands, the parent of KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell, said sales rose 12% in the first quarter.
items.contentSnippet: Yum Brands, the parent of KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell, said sales rose 12% in the first quarter.

items.title: GLP-1s can help employers lower medical costs in 2 years, new study finds
items.content: As broader approval for GLP-1 weight loss drugs spurs higher demand, it's also causing employer drug spending to spike.
items.contentSnippet: As broader approval for GLP-1 weight loss drugs spurs higher demand, it's also causing employer drug spending to spike.

items.title: Starbucks stock falls as sales disappoint, turnaround pressures earnings
items.content: Shares of Starbucks have fallen 8% this year, as investors worry about tariffs and how they will affect consumer spending.
items.contentSnippet: Shares of Starbucks have fallen 8% this year, as investors worry about tariffs and how they will affect consumer spending.

items.title: Oddity Tech soars 15% after it raises outlook despite tariff threat
items.content: Il Makiage owner Oddity Tech saw another quarter of outsized growth, leading it to raise its guidance even as the threat of tariffs swirl.
items.contentSnippet: Il Makiage owner Oddity Tech saw another quarter of outsized growth, leading it to raise its guidance even as the threat of tariffs swirl.

items.title: Trump signs order easing some auto tariffs
items.content: The measures Tuesday aim to reduce the overall tariff level on vehicle imports that had resulted from separate levies "stacking" on top of one another.
items.contentSnippet: The measures Tuesday aim to reduce the overall tariff level on vehicle imports that had resulted from separate levies "stacking" on top of one another.

items.title: Pfizer CEO says tariff uncertainty is deterring further U.S. investment in manufacturing, R&D
items.content: It comes as drugmakers brace for Trump's levies on pharmaceuticals imported into the U.S. – his administration's bid to boost manufacturing in the country.
items.contentSnippet: It comes as drugmakers brace for Trump's levies on pharmaceuticals imported into the U.S. – his administration's bid to boost manufacturing in the country.

items.title: General Motors beats Wall Street estimates, reassesses full-year guidance amid auto tariffs
items.content: GM beat expectations but is reassessing its 2025 guidance and suspending any additional stock buybacks amid expected cost increases and industry uncertainty.
items.contentSnippet: GM beat expectations but is reassessing its 2025 guidance and suspending any additional stock buybacks amid expected cost increases and industry uncertainty.

items.title: Novo Nordisk opens weight loss drug Wegovy to telehealth; Hims & Hers shares rocket 23%
items.content: Novo Nordisk is racing to capture more patients now that many compounding pharmacies are restricted from making Wegovy copycats, with rare exceptions.
items.contentSnippet: Novo Nordisk is racing to capture more patients now that many compounding pharmacies are restricted from making Wegovy copycats, with rare exceptions.

items.title: Pfizer expands cost cuts, tops quarterly profit estimates even as sales fall
items.content: Pfizer maintained its 2025 guidance but noted it does not include any impact of tariffs or trade policy, "which we are unable to predict at this time."
items.contentSnippet: Pfizer maintained its 2025 guidance but noted it does not include any impact of tariffs or trade policy, "which we are unable to predict at this time."

items.title: JetBlue to partner with another U.S. airline in the coming weeks, president says

items.title: United Airlines grows highest-end Polaris airport lounge by 50% in battle for wealthy customers

items.contentSnippet: United has been expanding its Polaris lounges in Chicago and Newark to fit more customers.

items.title: SoFi CEO says fintech bank is bringing back crypto investing
items.content: SoFi was forced to drop crypto investing in late 2023 as part of becoming a regulated bank.
items.contentSnippet: SoFi was forced to drop crypto investing in late 2023 as part of becoming a regulated bank.

items.title: Temu adds 'import charges' of about 145% after Trump tariffs, more than doubling price of many items
items.content: Temu, which sold customers on the ability to "shop like a billionaire" started adding "import charge" to orders in response to Trump's tariffs on China.
items.contentSnippet: Temu, which sold customers on the ability to "shop like a billionaire" started adding "import charge" to orders in response to Trump's tariffs on China.

items.title: Donald Trump Jr. co-founds new private members club, Executive Branch, with a $500,000 fee
items.content: Executive Branch held a launch party that included members of President Donald Trump's administration as well as wealthy CEOs, tech founders and policy experts.
items.contentSnippet: Executive Branch held a launch party that included members of President Donald Trump's administration as well as wealthy CEOs, tech founders and policy experts.

items.title: NFL's Washington Commanders return to D.C. in $3.7 billion stadium deal
items.content: The Washington Commanders will return to the District of Columbia and redevelop their former RFK Stadium campus, the team announced.

items.title: Wealthy consumers upped their spending last quarter, while the rest of America is cutting back

items.contentSnippet: American Express and JPMorgan Chase, both of which cater to wealthier users with higher credit scores, saw spending increase to start 2025.

items.title: Corporate sponsors are backing away from LGBTQ+ Pride organizations

items.contentSnippet: Companies that were once loud and proud in sponsoring LGBTQ+ community celebrations are pulling back their funds amid an uncertain time for Pride organizations.

items.title: Plane tickets are getting cheaper as domestic travel demand weakens
items.content: Airlines are trimming their domestic schedules as leisure traveler demand comes in lighter than expected.
items.contentSnippet: Airlines are trimming their domestic schedules as leisure traveler demand comes in lighter than expected.

items.title: More Americans are financing groceries with buy now, pay later loans — and more are paying those bills late, survey says
items.content: Consumers are using buy now, pay later plans to pay for essentials such as groceries, as concerns around the economy grow.
items.contentSnippet: Consumers are using buy now, pay later plans to pay for essentials such as groceries, as concerns around the economy grow.

items.title: Buy now, stock up or delay: Here's what consumers are snapping up or putting off in the face of tariffs
items.content: Fears of tariff-related higher prices have motivated consumers to buy cars early, but it's also contributing to a hesitance to buy and a hunger for deals.
items.contentSnippet: Fears of tariff-related higher prices have motivated consumers to buy cars early, but it's also contributing to a hesitance to buy and a hunger for deals.
